p: Bioavailability and amino acid profile of some plant-proteins such as soy are similar to the ones of eggs. However, some anti-nutrients like phytates, tannins and saponins can affect protein absorption. Lower consumption of proteins, especially lysine and methionine amino acids have been reported in vegetarians compared to omnivores [ 47, 74]. Other studies show that the concentration of the amino acids methionine, lysine, tryptophan and threonine are generally lower in plant-based sources of proteins [ 73]. Nonetheless, a plant-based diet that is well planned and balanced, in which different amino acids are combined and complemented through different plant-based foods, does not result in protein deficit [ 73, 74].
